akn:section.akn:heading: Designation of Senate delegates to Conferences of the Interparliamentary Union

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 276c. Designation of Senate delegates to Conferences of the Interparliamentary Union On and after June 30, 1958, Senate delegates to Conferences of the Interparliamentary Union shall be designated by the Presiding Officer of the Senate. Not less than two Senators so designated shall be members of the Committee on Foreign Relations. (Pub. L. 85–474, title I, June 30, 1958, 72 Stat. 246; Pub. L. 94–141, title II, § 204(c), Nov. 29, 1975, 89 Stat. 762.)
Editorial Notes Amendments1975—Pub. L. 94–141 inserted at end “Not less than two Senators so designated shall be members of the Committee on Foreign Relations.”
